body:
> Since it's possible to extract per-recipe data from the public telemetry API, we can probably get this data directly from telemetry on each recipe web page, without having to store it inside Normandy, but simply fetch it as needed.

If it is reasonable to do so, I think this is the best way forward. It doesn't require changes to the server, which makes it easier to develop and iterate on. If querying these values on each recipe page isn't efficient enough, we can explore loading the code into Normandy's database.

Since it's possible to extract per-recipe data from the public telemetry API, we can probably get this data directly from telemetry on each recipe web page, without having to store it inside Normandy, but simply fetch it as needed.

If it is reasonable to do so, I think this is the best way forward. It doesn't require changes to the server, which makes it easier to develop and iterate on. If querying these values on each recipe page isn't efficient enough, we can explore loading the code into Normandy's database.
